description: About Us: Phi Consulting constructs innovation involving the most recent progressions in Information Technology. About Role: We are seeking an AI/ML Engineer to develop, deploy, and optimize AI-driven virtual agents, intelligent automation solutions, and machine learning models to enhance go-to-market (GTM) strategies, sales automation, and revenue operations. This role involves leveraging AI and NLP models to streamline customer interactions, automate sales processes, and develop predictive models for business optimization. The ideal candidate should have experience in AI-driven automation, LLM fine-tuning, NLP applications, and AI-enhanced workflow automation. Key Responsibilities: AI-Driven Virtual Agents & Automation The engineer will be responsible for developing and deploying AI-powered virtual agents to automate lead engagement, customer interactions, and workflow processes. This includes fine-tuning and integrating LLMs such as GPT, Claude, Llama, and Mistral to enhance conversational AI and intelligent decision-making. They will also implement NLP models for information retrieval, intent recognition, and response automation while utilizing open-source AI frameworks to develop scalable and cost-efficient AI solutions. GTM & Sales Process Optimization In addition to building intelligent agents, the role requires expertise in automating GTM and sales processes using AI. The engineer will leverage AI to automate lead qualification, customer segmentation, and data-driven engagement strategies. They will develop predictive models for sales forecasting, revenue growth, and pipeline optimization while implementing AI-driven workflow automation to improve operational efficiency. CRM integration with Salesforce, HubSpot, and Pipedrive will also be an essential part of the role. Machine Learning Model Development & Deployment Machine learning model development and deployment are crucial aspects of this role. The candidate should be able to build and optimize ML models for customer insights, sales optimization, and AI-driven process automation. They will deploy AI models using cost-efficient cloud platforms such as Google Vertex AI, AWS Bedrock, and Azure AI. Utilizing low-code/no-code AI solutions where applicable, they will develop rapid business automation tools while maintaining ML pipelines for continuous learning, model retraining, and performance optimization. Data-Driven Decision Making & Predictive Analytics Data-driven decision-making is at the core of the role. The AI/ML engineer will implement AI-driven forecasting models to predict conversion rates, customer engagement trends, and revenue growth. They will build custom AI-driven dashboards to provide real-time business intelligence and decision support while applying vector databases and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) models for intelligent search and knowledge retrieval. Optimization of AI models for real-time analytics and business performance tracking will also be a key responsibility. Required Skills & Experience AI/ML & NLP Expertise The ideal candidate should have hands-on experience in machine learning, NLP, and AI automation. They must be proficient in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, OpenAI API, Hugging Face models, and related frameworks. Strong knowledge of fine-tuning and deploying LLMs for business applications is required, along with experience in workflow automation and AI-based customer engagement. Software Development & Integration Software development and integration skills are also important for this role. The candidate should have experience integrating AI models with CRM platforms, customer data systems, and enterprise automation tools. They should have a strong understanding of data pipelines, model deployment, and cloud-based AI infrastructure. Familiarity with AI orchestration tools such as LangChain, LlamaIndex, and vector databases will be an advantage. Business & GTM Process Knowledge Business and GTM process knowledge are highly preferred. The candidate should understand sales automation, marketing optimization, and AI-powered revenue strategies. They should also have experience in AI-driven business process automation and operational efficiency, as well as knowledge of customer engagement models and AI-enhanced personalization. Soft Skills Soft skills such as problem-solving and analytical thinking are essential, along with the ability to work cross-functionally with product, engineering, and revenue teams. The candidate should be adaptable to emerging AI trends, automation tools, and data-driven decision-making. AI-Powered Recommendation Engines & Decision Systems The candidate must have experience working with AI-powered recommendation engines and intelligent decision systems. They should be capable of developing models that enhance decision-making capabilities and automate business intelligence processes. Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) & Generative AI Expertise in RAG models, generative AI, and real-time AI applications is mandatory. The candidate should be proficient in implementing and fine-tuning these models for enhanced knowledge retrieval, response generation, and automation of content-driven workflows. Open-Source AI Solutions & Cost-Efficient Deployment The candidate must be knowledgeable about open-source AI frameworks and have experience deploying AI models using cost-efficient strategies. They should be able to optimize AI models for scalable and efficient performance while ensuring minimal operational costs. Why Join Us? This role offers the opportunity to work on AI-driven automation projects with real business impact. The candidate will gain exposure to cutting-edge AI/ML technologies and industry applications while collaborating with cross-functional teams focused on scalable AI-powered innovation. The work environment is flexible, with opportunities for remote or hybrid collaboration after first 6 months of employment.
